name: MEZZOLOTH
senses: Blindsight 60 ft., Darkvision 60 ft.; Passive Perception 15

traits.name: Fiendish Restoration
traits.text: If the mezzoloth dies outside Gehenna, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Gehenna.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The mezzoloth has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.text: The mezzoloth makes two attacks, using Claws or Mercurial Trident in any combination.

actions.name: Claws
actions.text: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 14) from two of four claws, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

actions.name: Mercurial Trident
actions.text: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Force damage. Hit or Miss: The trident magically returns to the mezzoloth's claw immediately after a ranged attack.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.text: The mezzoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13): 1/Day Each: Cloudkill, Darkness, Dispel Magic

bonus_actions.name: Teleport (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.text: The mezzoloth teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It can teleport one creature it is grappling to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of its destination space.

Medium Fiend (Yugoloth), Neutral Evil
In their natural forms, mimics are little more than roaming stomachs, their blobby bodies covered with alien eyes and teeth. They can alter their color,
texture, and dimensions to duplicate inanimate objects of their approximate size. Mimics use their disguises as both camouflage and bait. Once victims
draw close, mimics strike, lashing out with their sticky pseudopods and toothy mouths. After consuming victims, mimics usually relocate, change form, and
await their next meal.
